ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Elovich type kinetics
ygData.msgSnippet: The only thing you can vary dynamically is the pre-exponential factor, by setting the value of the multiplier for a reaction. You can use the Matlab function

The only thing you can vary dynamically is the pre-exponential factor, 
by setting the value of the multiplier for a reaction. You can use the 
Matlab function setMultiplier to do this:

setMultiplier(gas, rxn_number, value);

By default, the multiplier for each reaction is 1.0.

You can't change the activation energy dynamically, but there is an 
undocumented feature of surface reactions that I think will do what you 
want. You can specify the coverage dependence of both the 
pre-exponential and of the activation energy.  This was added after I 
released the document on cti file syntax, so isn't described there (or 
anywhere else).  I've attached a short description of how to do this.  
See also file ptcombust.cti that uses this feature.

As far as adding other, non-Arrhenius rate laws, it is not hard to do 
but requires adding the appropriate code in the Cantera C++ kernel.  If 
you tell me what you want, I'll see if I can do it for the next 
release.

Dave



--Apple-Mail-12--146696193

On Jan 22, 2004, at 8:29 AM, y2kpac wrote:

> Once a cti file is called, is there a way to change one or more of
> the rate coefficients of one or more of the reactions (i.e. a Matlab
> command)?  I am interested in having dynamic activation energys for
> specific reactions in my surface mechanism that are dependent on the
> surface loading.
>
> ...or/and
>
> Is there a way to define additional cti file syntaxes for other rate
> laws apart from those already defined? i.e. apart from Arrhenius(),
> three_body_reaction(), falloff_reaction(), Troe(), SRI(),
> WangFrenklach(), and surface reaction.
>
>
>
